entry.code: java.sql.SQLException: Cannot connect to MySQL server on localhost:xxxx

row.entry: The MySQL JDBC driver recommended in the OGSA-DAI documentation is not compatible with the latest versions of MySQL. This is the case for MySQL 4.1.6 and 4.1.7 and may be the case for other versions.
Try an older version of MySQL or use [FIXME - another relational database].
You need a different MySQL JDBC driver.

entry.para: To address this problem all you need to do is use a newer version of the MySQL JDBC driver JAR which can be downloaded from:
If you have already deployed services using the incompatible JAR, follow these steps:

listitem.para: Replace the JAR file in the lib directory in the container. See [Where Does Stuff Go? - fixme link].

row.entry: This exception in thread "main" may arise due to clashes between the Xalan shipped with certain versions of Java and that shipped with the Globus Toolkit. Please see this OGSA-DAI FAQ for more information.
Please check up the OGSA-DAI website (www.ogsadai.org.uk) for any updates. In particular the OGSA-DAI FAQ although note that this also caters for the non-WSRF distributions of OGSA-DAI.
